body:
Comment 5: 
you've confused the difference between the value of a string "\r\n" and
its external representation "\\r\\n" in source code.
an easy way to get the latter is fmt.Printf("%q\n", theString).

if you read the output of Go from a file in Ruby, you will find that it's indeed
correct JSON. Only when you manually copy and paste the output to a Ruby
interpreter will you need to escape them.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
